alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 11:10AM EST until January 30 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Bibb, Houston, Twiggs and Monroe Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Oglethorpe Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, flood stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Monday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.8 feet on 02/05/1988. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued around 500 PM this afternoon.this evening at 1115 PM EST.
